channel.title: Kaspar Rufibach on Kaspar Rufibach
channel.description: Recent content in Kaspar Rufibach on Kaspar Rufibach

item.title: 2019/07: Advanced methods for group-sequential trials
item.description: Half-day pre-conference course at ISCB40 in Leuven. Details on the program are available here.

item.title: 2019/03: Advanced methods for group-sequential trials
item.description: Half-day course for Roche statisticians in Basel.

item.title: Integrating Phase 2 into Phase 3 based on an Intermediate Endpoint While Accounting for a Cure Proportion
Joint modelling of progression-free and overall survival and computation of correlation measures
item.description: This project was initiated within a four month full-time internship at Department of Biostatistics, Roche Basel. The academic supervisor was Jan Beyersmann, University of Ulm. The project became Matthias Meller’s MSc thesis with which he won the Bernd Streitberg Award 2018 of the German Region of the International Biometric Society.

item.title: A multistate model for early decision making in oncology
Treatment Effect Quantification for Time-to-event Endpoints - Estimands, Analysis Strategies, and beyond
2018/03: Group-sequential and adaptive clinical trial designs, with R practicals
item.description:
Full-day course organized by the Basel Biometric Section.

item.title: 2018: Optimism-corrected treatment effect estimates in subgroups displayed in forest plots for time-to-event outcomes
item.description: Initiated within three month full-time internship at Department of Biostatistics, Roche Basel. Co-supervised with Marcel Wolbers (Roche Basel) and the academic supervisor was Torsten Hothorn, University of Zurich.

item.title: Comparison of different clinical development plans for confirmatory subpopulation selection
2016: Joint Modelling of Overall Survival and Progression Free Survival
item.description:
Initiated within four month full-time internship at Department of Biostatistics, Roche Basel. The academic supervisor was Jan Beyersmann, University of Ulm. With this thesis Matthias won the Bernd Streitberg Award 2018 of the German Region of the International Biometric Society.

item.title: Bayesian Predictive Power: Choice of Prior and some Recommendations for its Use as Probability of Success in Drug Development
